div.head: THURSDAY, June 5th.
div.p:
Consideration of County Courts re
sumed.

MR. LAIRD moved that the Bill
remain over, for further consideration,
until next year.

HON. MR. POPE said that by the
terms of the North America Act, these
Courts will have to be established be
fore we go into Confederation, or the
Dominion will not be bound to pay
the Judges.

Mr. L. H. DAVIES regarded it as
foolish to establish Courts before Court
Houses were built for them to hold
their sittings in, and thought it would
be wise to allow the matter to lie over
until next session. He did not agree
with the hon. Leader of the Govern
ment that it was necessary to establish
these Courts before we went into the
Dominion. He would second the
resolution of the hon. member the
Leader of the Opposition.

After a few further remarks from
hon. members, Mr. Laird's resolution
was put and lost.
